metadata.title: CVE-2019-7309 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp functionfor the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that theinputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc-bin - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6 - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-amd64 - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-armel - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-i386 - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-lse - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-pic - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-s390 - 2.31-0ubuntu9
libc6-x32 - 2.31-0ubuntu9
locales - 2.31-0ubuntu9
locales-all - 2.31-0ubuntu9
nscd - 2.31-0ubuntu9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.31-0ubuntu9').
